title: Iris and Apollo
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Claude Gillot [1673-1722]. Émile Louis Dominique Calando [1840-1898] Paris, France (Lugt 837); probably his sale, 11-12 December 1899, Paris; acquired by his son Émile Pierre Victor Calando [1872-1953], Paris and Grasse, France (Lugt 426b). Helene C. Seiferheld Gallry, Inc., New York, NY [3]; Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by June 12, 1974 [4]; their gift to Museum, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. His collector's mark is stamped on the work (recto lower left.)
[2]. His collector's mark is stamped on the work (verso bottom.)
[3]. Inscription in pencil "1997 Seiferheld" (verso.) The Fishkoffs also purchased other works from this NYC gallery.
[4]. The Fishkoff loaned the work to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, on June 12, 1974; see curatorial file for loan form and list of works.

creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
